title: Understanding PivotTables
text: A PivotTable is a powerful tool in Excel that allows you to summarize and analyze data. It helps in organizing and comparing data in a flexible way.

title: Locating the Insert Tab
text: To create a PivotTable, you need to start by locating the 'Insert' tab on the Excel ribbon. This tab contains various options for inserting different elements into your worksheet.

title: Selecting Data for PivotTable
text: Before creating a PivotTable, you must select the data range that you want to analyze. This can be done by clicking and dragging over the cells containing your data.

hintAnswer: select the sheet tab, then select the data for the PivotTable, click 'Create PivotTable' (insert|tabs)
title: Creating the PivotTable
text: Once you have selected your data, go to the 'Insert' tab and click on 'PivotTable'. This will open a dialog box where you can choose where to place the PivotTable.
